content:
• Tuesday, April 23, 2013
  • CSCO

    Telecom equipment and optical component makers fall in AH trading in response to Juniper's...

    Telecom equipment and optical component makers fall in AH trading in response to Juniper's revenue miss and light Q2 guidance, and (in what's arguably the bigger news) AT&T's $2B/year capex budget cuts for 2014 and 2015. CSCO -1.8% AH. CIEN -2.5%. RVBD -1.4%. JDSU -3.4%. FNSR -1.3%. TLAB -1.6%. Many of these companies had surged last November when AT&T set lofty 2014/2015 capex targets. Other names that could fall tomorrow: INFN. FN. OPLK. CALX. ADTN.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 PM | 1 Comment

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY) hires The Brenner Group "to provide restructuring support and related management services in order to implement a company-wide restructuring plan." AFFY -3.9% AH. (8-K)

  • JNPR

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) expects Q2 revenue of $1.07B-$1.1B and EPS of...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) expects Q2 revenue of $1.07B-$1.1B and EPS of $0.22-$0.26, below a consensus of $1.11B and $0.27. Enterprise IT weakness blamed, telecom healthy. 2) Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) expects FQ4 revenue of $365M-$385M and EPS of $0.34-$0.40 vs. a consensus of $367.6M and $0.37.  Gross margin expected to be ~39.5%, up from FQ3s 38.8%. 3)RF Micro (RFMD) expects FQ1 revenue of $285M-$290M and EPS of $0.07-$0.08, largely above a consensus of $265.8M and $0.07. JNPR -6.4% AH. CREE -7.3%. RFMD -3.3%. (Juniper PR) (Cree PR) (RF Micro PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM

  • AAPL

    A little more on Apple: Implied FQ2 iPhone ASP of $613, down from FQ1's $641 (was emerging...

    A little more on Apple: Implied FQ2 iPhone ASP of $613, down from FQ1's $641 (was emerging markets discounting or a mix shift to older iPhones the culprit?). iPad ASP was $449, down from FQ1's $467 (shift to iPad Mini). Mac ASP of $1,378, up from FQ1's $1,359. iTunes/Software/Services revenue +30% Y/Y to $4.11B. Accessories +15% to $1.38B. R&D spend +33% Y/Y to $1.12B, SG&A +14% to $2.67B. Cash balance stood at $145B at quarter's end, up from prior $137B. AAPL resumes trading, shares are up 5.4% AH.

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ2 EPS of $10.09 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $43.6B (+11% Y/Y) beats by...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ2 EPS of $10.09 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $43.6B (+11% Y/Y) beats by $1.1B. 37.4M iPhones, 19.5M iPads, just under 4M Macs. Expects FQ3 revenue of $33.5B-$35.5B, below $39.3B consensus. Buyback increased by $50B. Shares halted. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

  • VMW

    Though VMware's (NYSE:VMW) Q1 results beat estimates, Q2 guidance is for revenue of...

    Though VMware's (NYSE:VMW) Q1 results beat estimates, Q2 guidance is for revenue of $1.21B-$1.24B, below a $1.26B consensus. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $5.12-$5.24B vs. a $5.21B consensus. License revenue is expected to grow 6%-9% in 2013, compared with total revenue growth guidance of 11%-14%. License revenue rose only 1% Y/Y in Q1, whereas total revenue (lifted by services) rose 13%. VMW -6.2% AH. EMC -2.3%. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM

    Broadcom (BRCM): Q1 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $2.01B (+10% Y/Y) beats by $100M. Expects Q2 revenue of $2.1B (+/- 4%), favorable to a consensus of $2.05B. Shares +2.7% AH. CC at 4:45PM ET (webcast). (PR)

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ3 EPS of $0.34 in-line. Revenue of $349M (+23% Y/Y) beats by $7.04M....

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ3 EPS of $0.34 in-line. Revenue of $349M (+23% Y/Y) beats by $7.04M. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • MXWL

    Maxwell (MXWL +6.9%) rallies strongly after announcing it's providing ultracapacitors for a...

    Maxwell (MXWL +6.9%) rallies strongly after announcing it's providing ultracapacitors for a braking energy recuperation system being installed on 27 light rail vehicles in the Portland, OR area. Though this particular deal isn't that huge, it could act as a proof-of-concept for future projects, particularly since the project is being funded by a DOT grant. And with Maxwell having closed yesterday near its 52-week low and 68% below its 52-week high thanks to investor angst over its accounting woes, a little good news can go a long way. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 1 Comment

  • Markets recover after a brief crash caused by an erroneous report the President had been injured...

    Markets recover after a brief crash caused by an erroneous report the President had been injured in an explosion at the White House. The news came about from AP's twitter feed being hacked. The White House says the President is fine, and the AP's White House correspondent calls the report "obviously false."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 33 Comments
  • CIT

    CIT Group (CIT -2.6%) is reiterated a Buy at BTIG following the earnings miss, with Mark Palmer...

    CIT Group (CIT -2.6%) is reiterated a Buy at BTIG following the earnings miss, with Mark Palmer noting the company's finance margin jumped 57 bps Q/Q to 4.43% vs. management's target range of 3-4%. CIT at this point should be less about restructuring and more about improving operations, he says. Also of note is the 2nd straight quarterly increase in tangible book value ($0.74 to $40.35), following 3 consecutive declines.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • FIO

    Q1 checks for Fusion-io (FIO +7.6%) indicate a slight improvement in enterprise demand and...

    Q1 checks for Fusion-io (FIO +7.6%) indicate a slight improvement in enterprise demand and easing competitive pressures, says Piper in a note giving the server flash module vendor a big lift ahead of Wednesday's FQ3 report. Though Fusion-io's 2013 slump has more to do with concerns about Apple and Facebook than enterprise orders, the Street is happy to hear bullish enterprise-related comments in light of recent numbers from OEM partner IBM.  Piper has long maintained a bullish stance on Fusion-io, which had a whopping 44.7% of its float shorted as of March 28. (Stifel upgrade)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • AMP

    Ameriprise Financial (AMP +2.3%) gains following last night's earnings as previously very...

    Ameriprise Financial (AMP +2.3%) gains following last night's earnings as previously very acquisitive management says large purchases are on hold. For now, the company will use some of its $2.3B in cash to bump the quarterly dividend 7.15% to $0.52/share. The annualized yield is now 2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • SCON

    Midday top 10 gainers: SCON +118%. MEMS +49%. CZR +29%. NFLX +24%. ARL +18%. CPLA +18%. VECO...

    Midday top 10 gainers: SCON +118%. MEMS +49%. CZR +29%. NFLX +24%. ARL +18%. CPLA +18%. VECO +17%. HSTM +17%. SANM +16%. ILMN +15%.
    Midday top 10 losers: CPRX -15%. IIVI -13%. UNTK -13%. ABIO -13%. CASM -10%. EFUT -9%. GASS -9%. TAX-OLD -8%. SIFY -7%. USTR -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • ARCH

    The EPA wins an important legal victory in a continuing battle with Arch Coal (ACI -4.5% over...

    The EPA wins an important legal victory in a continuing battle with Arch Coal (ACI -4.5% over the Spruce no. 1 West Virginia coal mining project. The case tests whether the EPA can revoke a permit for mountaintop mining after another federal agency had already approved it. For the coal industry, the fight symbolizes what it sees as an unjust power grab by the EPA.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 8 Comments
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC's (WFR +5.3%) SunEdison unit reaches a solar module outsourcing deal with Foxconn's solar...

    MEMC's (WFR +5.3%) SunEdison unit reaches a solar module outsourcing deal with Foxconn's solar manufacturing arm. Foxconn will produce up to 350MW of modules for SunEdison, which has a solar project pipeline of 2.6GW, at a Mexican plant. Given how module prices and margins have crashed amidst massive global oversupply, it's hard to blame MEMC for wanting to lower its manufacturing overhead and capex needs. (Petrobras deal)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • RF

    More on Regions Financial (RF +3.9%) Q1 earnings: Net interest income of $798M, off 4% Y/Y; net...

    More on Regions Financial (RF +3.9%) Q1 earnings: Net interest income of $798M, off 4% Y/Y; net interest margin up 4 bps to 3.13%. Noninterest income of $501M, off 4%. Noninterest expense of $842M, off 8%. Loans flat sequentially as growth in C&I offsets continued runoff in mortgages and consumer loans. Tier 1 common ratio of 11.2%. Tangible book value of $7.29/share, up $0.18 from Q4. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • ITW

    Illinois Tool Works (ITW) +3.1%) moves up on a mixed Q1 report that came in line on a per share...

    Illinois Tool Works (ITW) +3.1%) moves up on a mixed Q1 report that came in line on a per share basis but short on revenue. Net profit fell 27% Y/Y, as losses from discontinued operations and weaker organic revenue weighed on its bottom line. Investors appear to be taking a narrow improvement in current quarter revenue guidance to lift the shares higher today. The company now expects Q2 revenue to increase between 2.5% to 3.5%, while analysts had been anticipating a 3% revenue decline.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • ST

    Sensata Technologies (ST) +6.1%) trades up this morning after beating across the board on its Q1...

    Sensata Technologies (ST) +6.1%) trades up this morning after beating across the board on its Q1 result. Net earnings fell 11% Y/Y however, as the sensors and controls maker saw a 7% decline in sensors revenue drag down results and offset generally higher controls sales. The company reaffirmed FY13 guidance, and for the current quarter it expects to earn $0.50 to $0.54 per share on revenue of $485M to $505M. Analysts are looking for $0.53 on $496M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • IDXX

    Idexx Labs (IDXX -3.3%) slips after missing Q1 revenue estimates earlier today. The company is...

    Idexx Labs (IDXX -3.3%) slips after missing Q1 revenue estimates earlier today. The company is also pulling back on its initially bullish 2013 forecast, now saying it expects FY13 EPS to be around $3.40 - 3.46, below the Street's $3.54. Revenues are expected to be $1.38B to $1.39B, representing growth of 7% to 7.5% Y/Y. Organic growth is expected to come in lower, in the range of 7.5% to 8% as compared with previous guidance of 8% to 9%, which is largely due to the impact of unfavorable changes in FX rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (STM +8.8%) recoups its April losses after beating Q1 EPS estimates on the...

    STMicroelectronics (STM +8.8%) recoups its April losses after beating Q1 EPS estimates on the back of a 170 bps Y/Y improvement in gross margin to 31.3%. The European chipmaker is guiding for Q2's Q/Q revenue growth to be in a range of -0.5% to +6.5%, the midpoint of which is below a 5% consensus. But it also setting a gross margin range of 30.7%-34.7%, as restructuring efforts and the ST-Ericsson wind-down provide a lift. Digital Convergence (set-tops/TVs) sales were a relative strong point (+8% Y/Y), as was Memory & Security (+9%). On the flip side, Silicon Photonics sales dived 35%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • CZR

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR +32.7%) soar as investors bet the company's new growth...

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR +32.7%) soar as investors bet the company's new growth venture will help set it on a path to return to profitability. Unlike larger peers, Caesars lacks a presence in Macau to help it ride out sluggish growth in Las Vegas - but flush with $500M in funding from big-name partners, the new JV could tiptoe into new growth areas.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • IRWD

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -4.5%) slides on a big Q1 miss this morning. Revenue dropped 73%...

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -4.5%) slides on a big Q1 miss this morning. Revenue dropped 73% Y/Y on weak sales of its IBS drug Linzess, while losses widened significantly as its bottom line was hit hard by a 92% rise in total costs - due largely to the rollout of Linzess - and an 11% jump in R&D expenses.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • MET

    The insurance sector is broadly higher following the MetLife dividend hike. Worth remembering -...

    The insurance sector is broadly higher following the MetLife dividend hike. Worth remembering - Met (NYSE:MET) is a special case, until recently under the Fed's regulatory thumb due to its banking operations (now divested). PRU +2.8%, HIG +2.4%. Maybe most interesting is AIG +4.1% as investors ponder the capital return possibilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 4 Comments
  • MET

    MetLife (MET +5.2%) bumps its quarterly dividend to $0.275/share from $0.185 previously, a 48.6%...

    MetLife (MET +5.2%) bumps its quarterly dividend to $0.275/share from $0.185 previously, a 48.6% increase. It's the first dividend hike since prior to the financial crisis, and brings the annualized yield to 2.9%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • CAT

    More on JPMorgan's Caterpillar (CAT +1.4%) upgrade: Analyst Ann Duignan says excavator sales in...

    More on JPMorgan's Caterpillar (CAT +1.4%) upgrade: Analyst Ann Duignan says excavator sales in China suggest "a clear selling season is occurring" which should mitigate regional headline risk. Furthermore, CAT's underproduction has likely led to a "near-trough in Resource revenue and margins." Risks to the call include a deteriorating macro environment, a "deeper and longer mining capex decline," and higher interest rates. Ultimately, "the stock more than reflects these risks."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • LMT

    More on Lockheed Martin (LMT +2.2% to $98.01) Q1: net profit +13.9% to $761M, helped by lower...

    More on Lockheed Martin (LMT +2.2% to $98.01) Q1: net profit +13.9% to $761M, helped by lower tax expenses but hurt by special items of $151M. Sales breakdown: aeronautics -14% to $3.19B, partly because of lower F-16 deliveries; Missiles & Fire Control +13% to $1.99B; Space Systems +4% to $1.96B. Affirms 2013 EPS outlook of $8.80-9.10 vs consensus of $8.92, but says revenue will be at lower end of projection of $44.5-46B vs consensus of $45.12B, with sequestration to slice $825M off the figure. Drexel Hamilton upgrades LMT to Buy from Hold and gives it a price target of $110 vs $90 previously.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • CREE

    A rising Veeco lifts all LED boats: Cree (CREE +3.2%) and Rubicon (RBCN +7.2%) are joining...

    A rising Veeco lifts all LED boats: Cree (CREE +3.2%) and Rubicon (RBCN +7.2%) are joining Aixtron and GT Advanced in benefiting from Veeco's Q1 bookings figures and relatively upbeat Q2 commentary, which comes just a week after LED names were hit hard by a Digitimes report about MOCVD equipment price cuts. Cree is making new 52-week highs, while Rubicon remains 43% below its 52-week high. The rally comes as Toshiba (OTCPK:TOSBF) bolsters its LED chip ops by acquiring the chip-production assets of startup Bridgelux.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • SN

    Sanchez Energy (SN +5.9%) estimates Q1 production of 355M boe, a 106% Q/Q increase and 320% Y/Y,...

    Sanchez Energy (SN +5.9%) estimates Q1 production of 355M boe, a 106% Q/Q increase and 320% Y/Y, with current production in excess of 6K boe/day. Says five new Prost wells in the Marquis area have come online, with average initial production rates of 1,044 boe/day; three new Palmetto wells have come online with average initial production rates of 1,200 boe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (PAY +10.5%) tacks on a gain after announcing it landed a two-year contract to provide...

    VeriFone (PAY +10.5%) tacks on a gain after announcing it landed a two-year contract to provide managed services for as many as 100K POS payment devices operated by ChinaPnR. The deal will see the company handle complex payment devices for ChinaPnR in a market expected to boom.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • LXK

    Rivals Lexmark (LXK +13%) and Xerox (XRX -0.7%) are reacting very differently to their Q1...

    Rivals Lexmark (LXK +13%) and Xerox (XRX -0.7%) are reacting very differently to their Q1 reports. Lexmark, which had 22.3% of its float shorted as of March 28, is soaring following a Q1 beat and better-than-feared top-line guidance: the company expects Q2 revenue to drop 6%-8% Y/Y, a little above an 8.1% consensus. EPS is expected to come in at $0.80-$0.90 vs. an $0.89 consensus. Gross margin rose 40 bps Y/Y in Q1 to 39.8%. Xerox is down slightly following mixed results and Q2 EPS guidance of $0.23-$0.25, below a $0.26 consensus. 2013 guidance has been reiterated. H-P (HPQ +0.2%), a rival to both firms, is near breakeven on an up day for tech. (PRs: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • STX

    Storage/hard drive stocks are outperforming, possibly aided by Veeco's Q1 bookings numbers: the...

    Storage/hard drive stocks are outperforming, possibly aided by Veeco's Q1 bookings numbers: the company reported hard drive equipment bookings totaled $27M, down 7% Y/Y but up 60% Q/Q in spite of slumping PC demand. Veeco added on its CC (transcript) hard drive customers are "starting to make selective technology buy decisions" once more. STX +2.6%. WDC +2.6%. EMC +1.8%. NTAP +2.7%. XRTX +1.6%. QTM-OLD +5.1%. EMC reports tomorrow morning. Also, LED/solar equipment makers Aixtron (AIXG +9%) and GT Advanced (GTAT +2.7%) are getting a lift from Veeco's numbers and bullish Q2 commentary.

    Netflix (NFLX +24.6%) continues to skyrocket as sell-side PTs surge following a Q1 beat fueled by higher margins (aided by a Y/Y drop in content cash outflows) and domestic streaming adds at the high end of Netflix's guidance; for now, the Street is willing to overlook Q2 guidance for a sizable Q/Q drop in domestic streaming adds. The results demonstrate Netflix's model "continues to show operating leverage," says Cantor, raising its PT to $230. Content liabilities stood at $5.7B at the end of Q1, up $100M Q/Q.
